Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the power given to the commission of unelected bureaucrats in Washington to control Medicare patients' health care decisions.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the commission of unelected bureaucrats in Washington has been given the power to control Medicare patients' health care decisions.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the commission of unelected bureaucrats in Washington has been given the power to control Medicare patients' health care decisions.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations and opinions from experts that contradict the claim, suggesting that the commission does not have the power to control individual care decisions.
